function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Shift in energy use behavior","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in household energy use due to prolonged time spent at home during the covid-19 pandemic.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Non-weather normalized loads analysis increases the risk of incomplete understanding of load behavior across a day-long period, potentially leading to inaccurate conclusions.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Comparison of energy consumption across income levels may reveal disparities in access to resources and energy usage patterns, with potential implications for public health and well-being.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Study of hvac and non-hvac loads across pandemic and pre-pandemic periods may provide insights into the impact of public health crises on indoor environmental quality and disease transmission in built environments.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Dependence on outdoor weather conditions for hvac loads","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate load characterization of non-hvac loads","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited comparison of hvac consumption across years","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited sample sizes for household income data analysis","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Air conditioning contributing to the spread of the virus in indoor environments","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of construction workers to covid-19","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of cleanliness and sanitization on construction sites","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased medical waste generation during the pandemic, posing a risk to the environment and public health.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of covid-19 among construction workers due to proximity in the work environment.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduction in black carbon and nitrogen dioxide in the atmosphere, increase in ozone concentration","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of innovative technologies like drones and sensors may lead to over-reliance on technology and reduced human oversight, increasing the risk of missing safety hazards.","category":"Communication Network","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to clearly define and communicate zones of safety and hazard in the work environment, leading to increased risk of workers entering hazardous areas unintentionally.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Slowdown in project planning, design activities, inspections, and maintenance due to social distancing","category":"Settlement","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 causing disruption in construction industry workforce","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic impacting the health of construction workers in construction projects cp .","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Covid-19 pandemic impacting health and safety of construction workers","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Threat of virus spread due to construction activities","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Impact of weather-related natural disasters on construction operations","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reduction in the release of emissions leading to improved public health may lead to better ability to withstand pandemics","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Adverse impact on infrastructure due to reduced workforce and increased healthcare costs","category":"Settlement","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vulnerability of populations with poor air quality to pandemics","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High infectivity rate of covid-19","category":"Public Space","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimated modes of transmission","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possibility of vertical transmission of sars-cov-2 from mother to child","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral shedding in feces and other body fluids despite resolution of symptoms","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Viral presence in body fluids such as saliva, urine, semen, and tears","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of virus through aerosols and droplets during surgical and dental procedures as well as from infected patients while talking, coughing, and sneezing.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Virus transmission through contaminated surfaces fomites and the viability of the virus in aerosols for up to 3 hours and on different surfaces for 4-72 hours.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential transmission of the virus through the gastrointestinal tract.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Possible modes of transmission of sars-cov-2 including airborne transmission via aerosols.","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of covid-19 via fomites or surfaces","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Underestimation of modes of transmission","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of cross-contamination from stainless steel surfaces due to inadequate cleaning procedures and disinfectant application.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"No in vitro data on efficacy of hand washing against coronavirus contamination on hands.","category":"Water","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Human coronaviruses can remain infectious on inanimate surfaces for up to 9 days.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uncertain viral load on inanimate surfaces","category":"Surface","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown frequency of hand contamination with coronavirus","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting data on benzalkonium chloride efficacy against coronavirus at different concentrations and contact times.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Long persistence of coronaviruses on inanimate surfaces, up to 9 days at room temperature and 28 days at higher temperatures.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High transfer efficiency of viral load to hands from contaminated surfaces, with potential transfer to the face and mucous membranes.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Coronavirus persistence on surfaces and materials","category":"Surface","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variation in coronavirus persistence based on temperature and humidity","category":"Air","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Effectiveness of biocidal agents in inactivating coronaviruses","category":"Surface","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Contaminated dry surfaces serving as a potential source of coronavirus transmission.","category":"Surface","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient understanding of coronavirus persistence on inanimate surfaces.","category":"Surface","confidence":"High"}]}
